lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Thursday asked why no action was taken on the Nov. 2, 2007, letter written by Prime Minister Manmohan Singh to former Telecom Minister Andimuthu Raja favoring the transparent sale of valuable spectrum -- transmission airwaves -- by auctioning it. (The Hindu) The problem could have been prevented if Mr. Singh's advice was taken and Mr. Raja was not allowed to follow the first-come, first-served policy, according to the judges.

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Friday
